Generated Narrative: RequestGroup 470

instantiatesCanonical: High Risk Referral

status: Draft

intent: Proposal

subject: Jane Doe

action

id

HighRiskAssessment

title: Perform 5 year risk assessment

description: A 5 year risk assessment, either informal or formal using a validated instrument, will help determine if the patient may benefit from referral for high risk breast specialty evaluation. Women at higher than average 5 year risk may be candidates for referral to breast specialist to discuss primary risk reduction interventions. These may include medications to reduce risk (chemoprevention), risk reducing surgery or enhanced surveillance.

Documentations

-TypeLabelDisplayCitationUrl
*CitationUSPSTFBreast Cancer: Medication Use to Reduce Risk

US Preventive Services Task Force. Medication Use to Reduce Risk of Breast Cancer: US Preventive Services Task Force Recommendation Statement. JAMA. 2019;322(9):857–867.

https://www.uspreventiveservicestaskforce.org/uspstf/recommendation/breast-cancer-medications-for-risk-reduction

selectionBehavior: Any

action

id

5YRiskAssessment

title: Informal 5 year risk assessment

description: Perform assessment based on personal risk factors conferring increased risk of breast cancer. These may include: increasing age, younger age at menarche, older age at first live birth, nulliparity/lower parity, number of prior breast biopsies, heterogeneously and/or extremely dense breasts.

resource: Bundle: type = collection

action

id

5YRiskAssessmentTool

title: 5 year risk assessment instrument

description: The NCI Breast Cancer Risk Assessment Tool and the Breast Cancer Surveillance Consortium Risk Calculator are based on models tested in US populations and are publicly available for clinicians and patients to use.

Documentations

-TypeLabelDisplayUrl
*DocumentationNCI Breast Cancer Risk Assessment ToolNational Cancer Institute (NCI) Breast Cancer Risk Assessment Toolhttps://bcrisktool.cancer.gov/
*DocumentationBCSC Risk CalculatorBreast Cancer Surveillance Consortium (BCSC) Risk Calculatorhttps://tools.bcsc-scc.ucdavis.edu/BC5yearRisk

action.title: Perform 5 year risk assessment
action.description:
A 5 year risk assessment, either informal or formal using a validated instrument, will help determine if the patient may benefit from referral for high risk breast specialty evaluation.

Women at higher than average 5 year risk may be candidates for referral to breast specialist to discuss primary risk reduction interventions. These may include medications to reduce risk (chemoprevention), risk reducing surgery or enhanced surveillance.

action.description:
Perform assessment based on personal risk factors conferring increased risk of breast cancer.

These may include: increasing age, younger age at menarche, older age at first live birth, nulliparity/lower parity, number of prior breast biopsies, heterogeneously and/or extremely dense breasts.
